revealed_symptoms.ulceration: It’s like a cut or sore that just won’t heal, and sometimes it scabs over but comes right back.
revealed_symptoms.shiny or waxy bump: It looks kinda like a smooth, shiny pimple, but it never pops or goes away.
revealed_symptoms.pruritus: It’s super itchy sometimes, or feels kind of tingly, like a weird sensation under my skin.
revealed_symptoms.evolving: This thing keeps changing—getting darker, bigger, or just looking different than before.

hidden_symptoms.telangiectasia: There are these tiny, spidery red blood vessels around the spot that I didn’t notice before.
hidden_symptoms.border irregularity: The edges are all jagged, kinda messy, not smooth like my other moles.
hidden_symptoms.diameter >6mm: It’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing.
hidden_symptoms.satellite lesions: There are these little dots or spots popping up near the main one, like it’s spreading.
hidden_symptoms.asymmetry: One side of this mole looks different from the other, like it's lopsided or uneven.
hidden_symptoms.induration: It feels thicker or harder than the rest of my skin, like there's something under there.
hidden_symptoms.hyperkeratosis: There's this rough, flaky spot that won’t go away, and sometimes it peels.
hidden_symptoms.rapid growth: I swear this mole or bump got bigger really fast, like in just a few weeks.

interaction_metadata.diagnosis: skin cancer (likely squamous cell carcinoma or basal cell carcinoma)

patient_history.content: Hi, I'll be your doctor today. What brings you in?

Well, I've noticed a few things. There’s this thing that looks kinda like a smooth, shiny pimple, but it never pops or goes away. It also feels super itchy sometimes, or feels kind of tingly, like a weird sensation under my skin. And this thing keeps changing—getting darker, bigger, or just looking different than before. Plus, I have a cut or sore that just won’t heal, and sometimes it scabs over but comes right back.
Thank you for providing that information. Could you tell me more about the skin lesion? Has it changed in size, shape, or color over time? Has it ever bled or crusted over?
Yes, it keeps changing. It’s getting darker, bigger, or just looking different than before. It does sometimes crust over.
Thank you. Have you noticed any other similar skin lesions anywhere else on your body? Also, have you had significant sun exposure or sunburns in the past?
No, I haven’t noticed anything similar anywhere else. And yes, I have had a lot of sun exposure and a few sunburns in the past.

Thank you. Do you have a family history of skin cancer? Also, can you tell me whether the changes in your skin lesion have recently seemed to get worse? For instance, did the skin lesion appear to grow larger or more irregular recently? Have you had any treatments or interventions on this lesion?
No family history of skin cancer that I know of. And yes, the changes have gotten worse lately. It feels like it's growing, and it just looks different than before. No treatments or anything, though.
Thank you. Has the lesion spread to other parts of your body? Additionally, has the lesion caused you any significant pain? Have you noticed any swollen lymph nodes near the lesion?
No, it hasn’t spread. It doesn’t really hurt, and no swollen lymph nodes.

It also feels super itchy sometimes, or feels kind of tingly, like a weird sensation under my skin. And this thing keeps changing—getting darker, bigger, or just looking different than before. Plus, I have a cut or sore that just won’t heal, and sometimes it scabs over but comes right back.
